snippet: Bare essentials and clear plastic bags are the norm at N.F.L. games this season under new rules that were put in place after the Boston Marathon bombings in April.
abstract: NFL's stricter bag policy, put in place after Boston Marathon bombings in April, generally allows fans to carry only small purses, one-gallon freezer bags and clear plastic bags into stadiums; shoulder bags, backpacks, fanny packs and even diaper bags are now forbidden as league tries to reduce threats.
lead_paragraph: Bare essentials and clear plastic bags are the norm at N.F.L. games this season under new rules that were put in place after the Boston Marathon bombings in April.

headline.main: N.F.L. Fans Met by Tighter Bag Policy
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Fans Met by Tighter Bag Policy
